reviews.review_msg: Disappointing. Class was completely focused on a single textbook which was unanimously disliked by everyone. She never added anything to the textbook material or lectured, instead students presented the chapters to each other so class was pointless if you read the chapter. Grading is arbitrary and inconsistent, and doesn't give any real feedback.
The worst professor ! Never anwser your question

Professor Pollon is an awesome philosophy prof, he's incredibly knowledgeable inside and out of the field so even if he goes off on tangents it's still interesting. Bit of a tough marker on reflections, but he's generally flexible on what topic you choose to talk about. Participation in class will definitely put you ahead of the others so chime in.

Dr. Jennings is the kind of prof who is a mentor, the kind that one can only dream of or read about that were more common in the old institutes of higher learning. He challenges you to think.A treat of a lifetime to attend his class!

This class is extremely confusing, Attendance was not mandatory but there was participation marks. More than half the class did not show at all for the entire semester but somehow got a higher mark than someone who showed up to 3/4 of the lectures. There were no clear guidelines on how the exams were graded and was very subjective.

Awful teacher and TA. The lectures and readings were inaccessible. Some students really struggled. When the TA handed papers back, one person got an F. He joked that some students are incapable of 'doing philosophy', but need to fail miserably to find out.

I highly recommend this class! The lectures are really engaging and the focus is on thinking philosophically about contemporary issues, not learning about specific philosophers. The teacher makes the material extremely accessible and the readings are also easy to read through. This is a great elective if you need an upper division course.

The lectures were some of the best I have had at SFU. Very engaging, and you can tell that Lyle wants to be there and cares about the subject. Attendance isn't marked, but you kind of need the in-class content. Slightly tough grader, but worth it. Take this class!

One of my fav courses tbh - which ok maybe I'm biased bc the required courses for my CS degree are all pretty hard. But still! 3hour lectures were super engaging and fun (which is no easy feat for my easily distracted brain!) and prof Lyle was super approachable during OH/after class for questions. All assessments were written ans and v reasonable

Lyle is the least approachable professor I've had as a phil student at sfu. He is passive aggressive at best and belittling at worst. Do not take him if you can help it. Also the TA grades very harshly. Unhelpful feedback. He is really mean spirited and it's palpable.
The marking is very subjective and arbitrary. I felt that the TA just gave grades based on his personal opinions and preferences. Comments on assignments didn't make any sense

Lyle had fairly good communication so I can't say I agree with those comments, however I understand that everyone has different experiences. I do agree with the fact that the marking is very subjective. A lot of our marking was done by the TA and the comments didn't make sense but there was no way of submitting a request to have your work re-graded
Very subjective and arbitrary grading. Neither Lyle nor his TA respond to emails.
Lyle was a great lecturer for sure. He made this class super enjoyable by constantly engaging with the class. The texams were all written answers.

I was a bit scared to take PHIL300 due to a bad experience with another PHIL course but good thing I did! One of the most fun, engaging, and fascinating courses I've taken. Lyle is flexible and kind - stick around to talk to him after class if you want to get the most out of this class. Exams were very fair (you get to bring notes).

PHIL300 w Lyle was one of my fave courses at SFU. You get to look at topics you've definitely wondered about before (end of humanity, living in a simulation, etc.) through a philosophical lens. Lyle's ability to make philosophical concepts digestible and accessible makes him an outstanding lecturer. I'd take any class with him in a heartbeat.

Lyle is a phenomenal lecturer who is obviously passionate about delivering excellent content.

He is knowledgeable, very approachable, and managed to keep each class incredibly engaging. Not easy for a 3 hour lecture! He is also very clear on the learning expectations for the course.

I would absolutely take another course with Lyle in a heartbeat.

Super smart guy. He really wants students to engage and ask questions during his lectures and he wants to listen to everyone's opinion which shows that he is genuinely interested. I think his lectures could be way shorter if he was more to the point and concise and I also think students would be more interested and engaged if that were the case.

Midterm and exam are all base on course materials, pretty straight forward. Attendance and participation are highly recommended for a good grade. Don't be hesitate to ask him questions and send him emails, he will answer my questions patiently and explain the theories for me. He is very nice and happy to assist me when I am confused with the essay.

Lots of readings but if you attend lecture and pay attention to her notes you don't actually have to do the readings because she goes over all the main points in the reading. Have to put the effort in the papers for a good mark, midterm is hard if you don't study well. Very helpful in office hours, so asks questions then!
I really liked this course.  Took it a few years ago and still remember some of the lectures.

The prof is fine, shes friendly. I went to her office one time and pretty much told me to redo the paper entirely. She knows the useless stuff. Don't take this class unless your witting skills are excellent. You will not learn anything useful here and discussion is for those who see the world twisted. eg) the chair you're sitting on does not exist.
Good course, but you must attend lecture if you want to do well.  She is able to explain complex ideas very clearly.  Really enjoyed this class.

She is very nice, but very disorganized.  She was late almost every day, and twice she cancelled class at the last second.  Every time a question was asked she could not give a very convincing answer, didn't seem as knowledgable as most professors.

I didn't have any particular interest in philosophy before this course, but, I must say, this course really sparked an interest.  The prof. is very enthusiastic and is able to explain complex material in a clear and simple manner.  Overall, great!
Colin is killer. just be very precise in your wording; once you understand his style his classes arent bad.
